issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

fields.description: Gandiva-jar-osx nightly build has been failing for the past few days. From [https://github.com/google/error-prone/issues/1441] the issue seems to be error-prone version 2.3.3 currently used is incompatible with java 13 that is being used in the nightly build. Updating it to 2.3.4 should fix this.

comments.body:
[~kszucs] .

After my fix the gandiva-jar-osx build is again failing but for different reasons.

From the logs in [https://travis-ci.org/ursa-labs/crossbow/jobs/629591679] it seems the build is successful but fails in the deploy stage where it gets stalled and times out. Its failing for same reason for last two days. Do you have any idea why this is the case?

Thanks.

Hey [~projjal]! 

Seems like it is a travis deployment issue. We can use another approach implemented in the crossbow script (basically an alternative for the deployment scripts on various CI services), see the usage here https://github.com/apache/arrow/blob/master/dev/tasks/conda-recipes/azure.osx.yml#L76-L91

Installing the dependencies on Travis could be more complicated than porting the CI template to Azure (travis.osx.yml to azure.osx.yml).
